definition: in part, the actions and activities assigned to or required or expected of a person or group, force, take, or pull apart
details:
adverb
- in part
= synonyms: partially
noun
- the actions and activities assigned to or required or expected of a person or group
= synonyms: function
- the part played by a person in bringing about a result
= synonyms: contribution
- something less than the whole of a human artifact
= example: something less than the whole of a human artifact
= synonyms: portion
- a line of scalp that can be seen when sections of hair are combed in opposite directions
= example: a line of scalp that can be seen when sections of hair are combed in opposite directions
= synonyms: parting
- that which concerns a person with regard to a particular role or situation
= example: that which concerns a person with regard to a particular role or situation
- one of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole
= example: one of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole
= synonyms: division
- an actor's portrayal of someone in a play
= example: an actor's portrayal of someone in a play
= synonyms: role
- the melody carried by a particular voice or instrument in polyphonic music
= example: the melody carried by a particular voice or instrument in polyphonic music
= synonyms: voice
- the extended spatial location of something
= synonyms: region
- a portion of a natural object
= example: a portion of a natural object
= synonyms: piece
- assets belonging to or due to or contributed by an individual person or group
= synonyms: share
- something determined in relation to something that includes it
= example: something determined in relation to something that includes it
= synonyms: portion
verb
- force, take, or pull apart
= synonyms: separate
- come apart
= synonyms: separate
- leave
= synonyms: start
- go one's own way
= example: go one's own way
= synonyms: separate
- discontinue an association or relation
= synonyms: break
